instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is  coming 12.6V then gradually going to 0.v in 20-30 seconds
threads.message:
Hi All,

This is not a liquid damaged macbook. how ever got moisture near <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR>. Earlier no <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> . I replaced the caps and now i have steady 
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. But <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is coming 12.6v then gradually going down.

I replaced ISL625 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7020</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>. no change.

Any clue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is  coming 12.6V then gradually going to 0.v in 20-30 seconds
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> tries to appear.
L7030 voltage steady without F7040?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is  coming 12.6V then gradually going to 0.v in 20-30 seconds
threads.message: Spot on. #<SIGNAL>V3_S5</SIGNAL> was shorted. Replaced the shorted caps fan spinning. Thank you so much for your help.
